page.title: 02Environmental Conditions
page.content: The local authority have the power to institute proceedings against any person or company who infringe the Food Hygiene Regulations or the Health & Safety at Work Act. In the Bootle area in 1984 about 120 complaints were made concerning places of work and food premises.A total of about 3,000 visits were made throughout the year by the officers of that section.Proceedings were instituted on two occasions for selling food not fit for consumption. Legislation preventing the excessive pollution of the air and waterways is also enforced by the local authority. Locally,chemical waste,asbestos and noise seem to be the cause of most concern.Two hundred complaints of noise were received in the Bootle area during 1984,resulting in formal action on 10 occasions.
